languages.text: "Так вот как ты проникла на корабль и в обсерваториум, Нихель. Техносоратники, что предали нас, сообщили Калькасару коды доступа к мостику. А он передал их тебе". {n}В тихом констатирующем голосе Паскаля вибрирует пронзительная уверенность. Он не спрашивает, а выносит Суждение.{/n}

traits.locale_text: "Так вот как ты проникла на корабль и в обсерваториум, Нихель. Техносоратники, что предали нас, сообщили Калькасару коды доступа к мостику. А он передал их тебе". {n}В тихом констатирующем голосе Паскаля вибрирует пронзительная уверенность. Он не спрашивает, а выносит Суждение.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}
languages.original_text: "Так вот как ты проникла на корабль и в обсерваториум, Нихель. Техносоратники, что предали нас, сообщили Калькасару коды доступа к мостику. А он передал их тебе". {n}В тихом констатирующем голосе Паскаля вибрирует пронзительная уверенность. Он не спрашивает, а выносит Суждение.{/n}

traits.locale_text: "So that was how you got onboard the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our tech-comrades who had betrayed us gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing the Judgement.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: 「では、あなたが船に乗り、観察室へ入った方法はどうですか、ニヘル。自分たちを裏切った技術同胞がカルカサルにブリッジへのアクセスコードを教えた。カルカサルがそれをあなたに教えた」{n}強い確信がパスカルの声を振動させ、事実を静かに告げる。パスカルは質問をしているのではない、ジャッジメントを通しているのだ。{/n}
languages.original_text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}

traits.locale_text: 「では、あなたが船に乗り、観察室へ入った方法はどうですか、ニヘル。自分たちを裏切った技術同胞がカルカサルにブリッジへのアクセスコードを教えた。カルカサルがそれをあなたに教えた」{n}強い確信がパスカルの声を振動させ、事実を静かに告げる。パスカルは質問をしているのではない、ジャッジメントを通しているのだ。{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: “原来你就是这样登上这艘船，进入瞭望台的，妮赫尔。我们反叛的技术伙伴把通向舰桥的密码给了卡尔卡扎，而卡尔卡扎又把它传给了你。”{n}帕斯卡平静地陈述着事实，声音里回荡着强烈的信念。他并不是在提问，而是在下达判断。{/n}
languages.original_text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}

traits.locale_text: “原来你就是这样登上这艘船，进入瞭望台的，雅珀。我们反叛的技术伙伴把通向舰桥的密码给了卡尔卡扎，而卡尔卡扎又把它传给了你。”{n}帕斯卡平静地陈述着事实，声音里回荡着强烈的信念。他并不是在提问，而是在下达判断。{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: « C'est à ce moment-là que vous êtes montée à bord du vaisseau pour rejoindre l'observatorium, Nihel. Nos technoconfrères félons avaient donné le code d'accès de la passerelle à Calcazar, qui vous les a ensuite transmis. » {n}Pasqal énonce ces faits avec conviction, sans laisser transparaître le moindre doute. Il ne pose pas de question, non. Il prononce un jugement.{/n}
languages.original_text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}

traits.locale_text: « C'est à ce moment-là que vous êtes montée à bord du vaisseau pour rejoindre l'observatorium, Nihel. Nos technoconfrères félons avaient donné le code d'accès de la passerelle à Calcazar, qui vous les a ensuite transmis. » {n}Pasqal énonce ces faits avec conviction, sans laisser transparaître le moindre doute. Il ne pose pas de question, non. Il prononce un jugement.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: «Ah, así fue como subiste a bordo de la nave y entraste en el observatorium, Nihel. Nuestros traidores tecnocamaradas proporcionaron a Calcazar el código de acceso al puente, y luego él te lo dio a ti». {n}La voz de Pasqal resuena con una profunda convicción mientras pronuncia estas declaraciones. No está preguntando, sino emitiendo un Juicio.{/n}
languages.original_text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}

traits.locale_text: «Ah, así fue como subiste a bordo de la nave y entraste en el observatorium, Nihel. Nuestros traidores tecnocamaradas proporcionaron a Calcazar el código de acceso al puente, y luego él te lo dio a ti». {n}La voz de Pasqal resuena con una profunda convicción mientras pronuncia estas declaraciones. No está preguntando, sino emitiendo un Juicio.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: "So konntet Ihr also an Bord des Schiffs und in das Observatorium gelangen, Nihel. Unsere verräterischen Techkameraden haben Calcazar die Zugangscodes zur Brücke gegeben. Und er hat sie Euch gegeben." {n}Akute Überzeugung vibriert in Pasqals Stimme, als er diese ruhigen Tatsachenfeststellungen vornimmt. Er stellt keine Fragen. Er verkündet den Richtspruch.{/n}
languages.original_text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}

traits.locale_text: "So konntet Ihr also an Bord des Schiffs und in das Observatorium gelangen, Nihel. Unsere verräterischen Techkameraden haben Calcazar die Zugangscodes zur Brücke gegeben. Und er hat sie Euch gegeben." {n}Akute Überzeugung vibriert in Pasqals Stimme, als er diese ruhigen Tatsachenfeststellungen vornimmt. Er stellt keine Fragen. Er verkündet den Richtspruch.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion

languages.text: "Demek gemiye bu şekilde bindin, gözlemhaneye bu şekilde girdin Nihel. Hain tekno yoldaşlarımız, köprüye girmesi için gereken erişim kodlarını Calcazar'a verdi. O da sana tabii." {n}Bu gerçekleri sessizce sıralayan Pasqal'ın sesinde şiddetli bir inanç peyda oluyor. Şu an soru sormuyor... Hüküm veriyor.{/n}
languages.original_text: "So that was how you got on board the ship and into the observatorium, Nihel. Our traitorous tech-comrades gave Calcazar the access codes to the bridge. And he gave them to you." {n}Acute conviction vibrates in Pasqal's voice as he makes these quiet statements of fact. He is not asking questions; he is passing Judgement.{/n}

traits.locale_text: "Demek gemiye bu şekilde binip, gözlemhaneye bu şekilde girdin Nihel. Calcazar'a köprüye girmesi için gereken erişim kodlarını hain tekno yoldaşlarımız verdi. O da sana verdi." {n}Bu gerçekleri sessizce sıralayan Pasqal'ın sesinde şiddetli bir inanç peyda oluyor. O şu an soru sormuyor. Hüküm veriyor.{/n}
traits.speaker: PascalCompanion
